intro: Talinella ankaranensis, commonly known as the Ankaranensis moonflower, is a rare and striking plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, hard seeds. Its botanical features include hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. Talinella ankaranensis is of particular interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and limited distribution.
